Reviews.Title: “Cars commonly burglarized in area”
Reviews.Author: j s
Reviews.Content: Don't be another victim. Cars commonly being burglarized even within 3 parking spots of the entrance under lights. Security camera "turned off". Plenty of nice hotels in the hotel district. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Better than your Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkellum13
Reviews.Content: Clean, large rooms that were very comfortable. The rooms were extremely clean and accommodating. I love the Comfort Inn soaps, lotions. They always smell good. The breakfast was very nice in the morning before my flight out. I wish I would have had time to return my rental car the night before and taken the shuttle. They seemed very organized and were very friendly to patrons that they were taking to the airport. The business center computers were also very fast so I could quickly get my boarding passes printed. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTraveler2
Reviews.Content: The hotel/suite was clean and comfortable. Nice breakfast. First time staying at Comfort Suites. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Misstonie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for an early 5am flight out of BWI. The service was good, but the rooms were terrible. Broke down lamps that didn't work, dingy furnishings, type of room where you didn't want to walk directly on the carpet or touch certain items. I asked for a room where i could keep an eye on my car from the parking lot since the place isn't in the best area. Good service, dingy rooms at best. Place needs an overhaul. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Inn-BWI for its proximity to the airport. I've visited several hundred hotels in my lifetime, and this undoubtedly ranks as one of the five worst (especially for the price). The one bright spot: the woman at the desk was very nice and helpful. The accommodations were terrible, however. We were given a handicap-accessible room on the ground floor next to the main hotel entrance (there were no other rooms available?... really?). There was no light switch by the door, meaning we had to feel our way to the bathroom switch. The dingy curtains could not fully close, allowing light from the parking lot and the gazes by anyone entering/leaving the hotel to enter our room. My wife and I shared five tiny pillows on a king-sized mattress that lacked comfort. The bathroom cleanliness should have been better, and the fixtures had some rust and could use an upgrade. To top it all off, a $3 clock radio was located on the *opposite side of the room as the bed* and could not be moved to the nightstand because there were no outlets nearby. These conditions are an embarrassment to the Comfort Inn brand.

Reviews.Title: “They closed with no notice..what the hell happened?”
Reviews.Author: BikeDriver333
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying across the way at Sleep Inn which was great, and more than fairly honored the same rate and service level, but the Comfort Inn just slammed its doors with no notice, earlier this week I understand. What a homecoming!! I booked a hotel with parking deal at stay123.com, and they found available rooms for us at SLeep Inn, but i was worried because my car was already parked at Comfort Inn. They mentioned nothing when I parked and took the shuttle to BWI last week, and the people at SLeep Inn were nice enough to come pick us up from the airport, and bring us back, as they took over our room reservation - at the same price. Sleep Inn was nice but the people at Comfort Inn pissed me off.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryQ569
Reviews.Content: Very dated. Badly needs rennovating. Felt sorry for the receptionist when I checked-in as she was clearly feeling the stress of being the only person on duty.

Reviews.Title: “10/14/11”
Reviews.Author: pompui
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the worst customer service I have ever encountered. The folks at the desk were ok but when I tried to contact mgt I could not get a call back. I tried several times but no response. Can't understand that and don't respect that.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near bwi”
Reviews.Author: andremodesto
Reviews.Content: i went for a 3 day convention near washington dc and chose this hotel. it has a great breakfast, and it's a bit far from washington, but that's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Empathy and Security”
Reviews.Author: curysue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually purchase a park, sleep, and fly package from this inn when we fly from BWI. Even though the reviews were scarey, we took a chance. This was a good decision. Our room was clean and well furnished. I saw security in the parking lot. The shuttle driver was so helpful and nice. The front desk crew were wonderful. They patiently answered our questions and printed our boarding passes. I am so appreciative of their service. My husband became ill on our return flight and had to be taken from BWI by ambulance to an area hospital where he was admitted. I called the inn to explain why our car was still in their lot. To my relief - since I was away from home with a seriously ill husband and no way to get our car - I was assured that it could remain in the lot until I could have it picked up. When we got the car, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Category-killer . . . best in its price class”
Reviews.Author: sbabones
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn at BWI is not the sort of hotel you go to on vacation, for your honeymoon, or to hold a major international conference. It is, however, an extraordinarily clean, comfortable, friendly hotel. The reason I gave it four stars instead of five was that the hotel has minor maintenance problems: the air conditioning unit in my room was old and noisy; the hot water tap worked but was not correctly installed; HBO was mysteriously blank even though it was listed on the hotel channel list. Nonetheless, as a traveler diverted to BWI due to a missed flight connection, I was thrilled to get a room at the Comfort Inn for $70 and to be greeted cheefully at 1:00 am by the staff. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I've read the other reviews, have now stayed here, and I have to agree...”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl75555
Reviews.Content: ...this place is awful!! The only nice thing I can say is that the staff was nice... and then there's the room My room smelled terrible (moldy). I found someones hair stuck in my wash cloth, and the bathroom sink, counter top was dirty....tub--dirty! More hair on bathroom floor. The carpet looks dirty...the bed spread looks dirty...awwwhhhhh!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: FormerGuest_11
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! Please read if you would like to know why. The hotel desk staff was very demeaning and unfriendly. The hotel is quite run down and much dirtier than was expected for a Comfort Inn. The airport shuttle that the hotel provides as a courtesy left us standing in the extreme heat at the BWI MARC station, not once but twice for well over an hour. We finally gave up on the second time and took another means of transportation. When I addressed this with the desk staff, the desk staff threatened to call the police on me even though I was calmly adressing my concerns. I thought it was my presentation but when we were awaiting our shuttle to the cruise port I noticed that every guest was having extreme difficulty with the hotel desk staff regarding transportation. Every time we attempted to enter our room with our key card the lock would not work. The front desk accused me of placing it next to other cards or perhaps a cell phone. Finally the maintenance personnel had to change the battery in the door. It work sporadically thereafter. They messed up our reservations and although we had requested a king room we went to our room to unpack it was a two double bed room and it looked like someone was staying in that room but just wasn't there, thankfully no one was there. We were assigned another room but it still was with two doubles. I'm 6 foot 5 inches, 270 lbs and there is no way I could sleep in a double bed with my wife so we spent three nights sleeping in separate beds. After adresseing our multitude of concerns with the on-duty manager I mentioned that Choice Hotels are my first choice of hotel stays and asked what he was willing to do to keep my business. After a 20 minute discussion he eventually credited me one night stay but in my opinion and after what we went through for 3 days I should have received more. I will be writing to the Choice Hotels corporate office about this facility and my experience. My only recourse now is writing reviews and making it hurt where it hurts them the most, in revenue and hotels guests.

Reviews.Title: “OK place, would try a different place next time”
Reviews.Author: catzmom20
Reviews.Content: Stayed there overnight so we (four of us) could catch a flight the next day. The room was really small and a bit outdated and just did not seem clean. For one night it was ok but would not want to stay any longer. They provided a shuttle to and from the airport and we left our car parked there while we were gone. It was convenient. I chose them because they provided a complimentary breakfast and we were taking a long flight the next day so I figured it would save us time not having to find a place to eat. The food was good, but the dining area was not kept up well and again just did not seem clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: roachman51
Reviews.Content: Be advised. This hotel is basically located in a part of town where all the businesses have bars on their windows and doors. The hotel should have been refurbished 10 years ago. It's worth the drive to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “People were down right rude”
Reviews.Author: sawders1
Reviews.Content: The room was pre booked. I wanted 2 doubles and a cot. The room was $190. We got @ the hotel and in the room and there was no cot and wash clothes. We asked and was ignored for more then 10 Minute. Finally the nasty staff said ok but they wanted more $$ for cot, showed pre reservation and all was ok? Went to aquarium came back @ 11:30 PM still no cot until 12 AM. Never got wash cloths. Room was clean. Remote for TV was broke.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Come Back & Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MArasu2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Comfort Inn during my visit to my customers office in March 2011. The property is situated pretty close to the BWI airport and offers complimentary Airport Shuttle for pick-up and drops round the clock. The staff were pretty good and so was the cleanliness of the room and the hotel. The Hotel has a large restaurant where the complimentary breakfast is served - though I missed the waffles that are served in most Comfort Inns. The wireless Internet was pretty stable and fast, unlike a few other hotels that I stayed at during this travel. There were a lot of conf. rooms where I saw a lot of seminars and meetings being conducted.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here if you want your car stolen or broken in to!”
Reviews.Author: xcrunch
Reviews.Content: As with several other reviews, if you stay at this hotel you are taking risks. We stayed here in January before going on a cruise, and that night 14 cars we broken into, with one stolen. OK we said things can happen, but we find out from the police that in the previous two weeks over 140 breakins in that area have occurred. What bothered us the most was when we arrived (before we signed any wavier,which they make you sign) we asked the receptionist whether they had any breakins to the cars. She said no, obviously lying to us. We would have never stayed there if we had known the truth. In addition, we were told that they had just gotten rid of there security company. We have tried to contact the hotel (the general manager), who just does not want to do anything. There are other hotels which have fenced in areas. Do yourselves a favour. Don't stay here and take the chances.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to park car while flying or cruising out of Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: NorthArrow
Reviews.Content: The best deal for parking: stay one night and leave your car for up to 14 nights and have free shuttle to and from cruiseport or airport. The shuttle to cruiseport was quite convenient with a very helpful and courteous driver. The pickup from cruiseport took longer because of the large number of passangers/customers disembarking at the same time. But it was well worth it for the convenience and cost. Hotel room: basic but adequate. Good breakfast with coupon in adjoining restaurant. We'll stay here again when next we fly or cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: PattKoller
Reviews.Content: I loved the Comfort Inn. Frankly, I dreaded this trip. My husband litterally bribed me to go. Old sailors. Old Ships. Old war stories. And then I read the reviews of the hotel. Thought I would never get through the week. Turns out, the hotel is delightful! Little things drive me nutz. And little things make me happy. Room window opens! Toilet & Tub close off from Sink & bed. Toilet seat LID! Full length mirror. Lots of drawers & storage. AND a flat screen TV, which was important only because we were there the week of the beginning seasons of all the shows I like. The staff is delightful. Maybe a little quirky. First night, fire alarm goes off. No actual fire. But, the management could not find the key to reset the alarm. So we all stood out in the drizzle for almost an hour. I met a young marine & some new recruits staying the night. Finding Ice Machines is a good trick. But breakfast is a real breakfast. I ate more bacon in 5 days than I do in an entire year at home. The bed was comfortable. Tiny, tiny pillows. But our daughter says that is so they can "wash" them. I can live with tine CLEAN pillows. Yes, I would recomend & return. Not a Marriot, but not a Marriot invoice either. For the price & room, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bad place to stay at very high crime area.”
Reviews.Author: gibbs0431
Reviews.Content: Stayed there and parked for 10 days came back and my vehicle was stolen.Would NEVER stay there or park there again.Absolutely NO sercurity of ANY sorts.They take your license number down and give you a ticket to put on dash as a way of saying come steal me I'm not around for awhile.Had to call the police and they said the AREA is high in crime.Cars are a common thing to get stolen here.NO fences,NO gaurds,NO camra's,NO nothing....just your out of luck when your car dissapears.The motel is NOT the greatest of places either.VERY RISKY staying here!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cside12
Reviews.Content: I was greeted very cordially and made to feel quite at home. Then I went to my room and was pretty disappointed with everything from that point on. I was very thirsty and wanted a bottle of water. I found a vending machine on my floor. It was out of order. I headed to the lower level to order dinner and found a vending machine there. It was also out of order. The place is not necessarily dirty -- just old and in desperate need of remodeling. Food was decent. Happy hour was good. I travel quite a bit for business and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty with bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Travelz50
Reviews.Content: We called four times and waited over an hour at the airport for the shuttle,. The driver was rude. The place is run down, carpets dirty. It was just one night so we stayed. Opened the drapes in the a.m. and the sheers had bugs all over them. Gangbanger types were hanging around the hotel and roaming the halls.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: informedtraveleril
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while going to the Jazz Festival in DC, and other places in the area. The staff were very pleasant. The shuttle service was great, and one of the drivers even took me to the Amtrak station. The shuttle picked me up twice, and arrived within 15-20 minutes of my call. The breakfast was good, but I think I got a little burned out on the same breakfast after two days, so I ate breakfast somewhere else after the 2nd day. My toilet backed up, and the staff responded within minutes to my request. When I came back to my room the toilet was fixed. Someone in an earlier post said the bedspreads need to be replaced. I agree. Mine had a spot on it, and I am not sure what it was. Otherwise, the hotel was clean, and the rooms were spacious. The even have complimentary cookies and apples in the lobby!! The soup at the Rose restaurant was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SC_Traveler999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights will attending business event. Hotel was pretty standard for moderate price but room was larger than most and included small sofa and desk. Wireless internet was available but slow from my room. Best feature of stay was included breakfast. Guests receive coupon for breakfast buffet in adjoining restaurant. Great selection of hot breakfast foods. Definitely a far step above most 'free' breakfasts included with Comforts. Definitely would recommend when traveling to downtown Baltimore area venues are only minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Inauguration”
Reviews.Author: araa7
Reviews.Content: We flew in from California for the inauguration and had a wonderful experience. We arrived in Baltimore late and called the hotel for the shuttle which picked us up within 20 min. of arrival. The room was in good condition, a little out dated but clean. The staff was helpful. You get a compimentary breakfast coupon you can use at the restaurant next door for each night you stay. Bacon, scrambled eggs, pancakes, etc. The restaurant also offers room service. The hotel is also near a convenience store and some food places. We would take a taxi to the metro in the morning to go into DC and a bus to the airport at night then you could call the hotel shuttle or take a taxi($15) back to the hotel if you didn't want to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book Counting On A Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: sbsdesign04
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily due to the low nightly rate and complimentary airport shuttle. When we checked in we asked for a shuttle for 4:30 am. We were in the lobby at 4:15 am and were told that the shuttle would be there around 4:30. 4:30 rolled around no shuttle. 4:45 still no shuttle. We had a 6:45 flight to catch so we asked the night manager when the shuttle would be there. Turns out that the shuttle was not exclusive to this hotel and picked up at another hotel for this chain as well. It was full and continued on. Take note that there were 8 in our group. So finally around 5:00 a shuttle pulls up and surprise, surprise there is not enough room for our group. Three other groups call taxi cabs and continue on. Meanwhile the manager keeps saying that a shuttle will be there soon. In all approximately 25 people stood there and waited and waited for a shuttle to come. We finally ended up getting in our personal vehicles and driving our party plus two lovely older ladies who were also waiting for the shuttle to the airport. So it cost us the cost of the rooms plus $64 in parking fees because of their complimentary airport shuttle. To make matters even worse my inlaws had a problem and missed their flight. Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: up.hillKansasCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night because of a flight problem, so we did not get a total experience. The staff was okay, pleasant enough. Although I can't put my finger on it, it just had a feeling of not being very clean. It's probably okay for a cheap sleep and run hotel, but I don;t know that I would want to stay for several days on vacation or anything.

Reviews.Title: “shabby and outdated”
Reviews.Author: twelveoaks12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very shabby and outdated in the interior. Also, the room was dirty and the carpet was filthy. The front desk staff was indifferent. However, the shuttle service was very good. Room rate was $153 with tax which was NOT a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: nosnowbunny
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel. Smells like mildew as soon as you walk into the lobby. Had to switch rooms, 1 is as bad as the next. Every room smells like mold and mildew, would not even sit on the bed, bedspreads are dirty and old, GROSS! Checked right back out after checking in, within 5 minutes. This is the worst hotel I have ever seen! Don't be fooled by location. It's about 5 minutes away from the actual airport, and that's if there is no traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok Marriott is better”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: I cant place my finger on it,but I don't get a good nights rest here. Check in seems to take forever and the rooms are, well,just ok. I never felt like they were clean and beds were not the best. For the price difference and a good night sleep I take the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprized”
Reviews.Author: tree6199
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old son, and I stayed at the Comfort Inn in Baltimore for two nights to visit the city and go to Camden Yards to see a Yankee game. As soon as we entered the hotel I knew I had chosen the right place. It was nice and clean and new looking. I was expecting more of a bare bones motel type place, but for the price this place was really nice. You get a free breakfast with the room, and it's a real breakfast, not just some stale pastry. The only complaint I can even think of is that the shower drain was slow. The towels are white and nice and plush, the front desk and housekeeping staff and very efficient. You can walk about two blocks and pick up the light rail that takes you into the Inner Harbor area for $3.50 per person. Actually, since nobody checked our tickets we could have rode for free. Also, the Inner Harbor is fun to walk around, and the place was just LOADED with Yankee fans. We took over the area!! The game was a lot of fun too. (Yankees won!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay; good value”
Reviews.Author: pha1226
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a park/sleep/fly package. The staff was nice and helpful. The room was clean and fine for one night. The light rail stop was close but you need to cross two busy streets to get to it. We had no problem taking the light rail to the Orioles game. The complimentary breakfast was only ok. The shuttle left every half hour as scheduled. We used the phone at the airport to get picked up and it arrived in 15 minutes to take us back to our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the BWI Comfort Inn. Pick up at the airport was timely and the driver was very nice. The clerk at the front wasn't much, a bit rude but we did get checked in. The beds are great, nice and fluffy, the bathtubs are really strange but all in all was clean and quiet. Close to the Metro line to go into Baltimore and had no problem navigating. Ate at the Rose restaurant for the breakfast, I would skip this even though it is free, food wasn't great. No service, couldn't even get coffee from anyone. Pretty remote area if you don't have a car, not much around it, a Checkers and Circle K across the street. We ate the Rose for dinner and the food was good but service was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Take the Family!”
Reviews.Author: mrrick747
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Baltimore (BWI) to see a Baseball Game.. We stayed at the Comfort Inn Airport and were very pleased! The price was about a hundred bucks for 3 of us including tax and while the name of the motel would lead you to believe its on the runway, its actually a few miles away and out of the "airport hustle". The staff were very pleasant and the room was clean and quiet, in fact, with a house full of Red Sox fans, you could hardly tell it from any other day.There is also a hotel shuttle to BWI which runs on the half hour and the driver very friendly. I could not find a pool, however, there is a Sleep Inn next door, which may be a sister motel and you could probably use theirs. There was a Complimentary full Country Breakfast in The Rose Restaurant part of the Comfort Inn Airport and all in all, the motel experience was great, all this considering we just wanted a clean room close to the Light Rail Station. The station is virtually across the street from the Hotel and by station I mean a handful of ticket machines, a few benches and some rail. The train slips in quietly and then slips away at the cost of 3.50 for a day pass, oddly enough, there was never anyone to take the ticket, look at it or scan it all day, could have travelled all day without. The Rail also connects to Bwi but we didnt use it because of the motel shuttle. We rode maybe 10 stops, 15 minutes and we were at Camden Yards, a beautiful park, a beautiful setting. With thousands of Red Sox fans invading the park, our Baltimore hosts could not have been more gracious. Baltimore should be very proud of this park and the conduct of the Oriole faithful, it is certainly recommended that a family would have a great time here!!! After the game we went to Hard Rock Cafe and ESPN zone, however there are other family activites close by as well. After our day in Baltimore we slipped back on the rail and were back at our Hotel. There was nothing less than excellent on this day trip ....no wait, thats right, the Red Sox lost. Still, hats of to Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “let's not say comfort”
Reviews.Author: imalocal
Reviews.Content: Rude staff. Dirty. Towels appeared to have been already used; staff not willing to replace them. Barking dog in adjacent room kept me up most of the night; complaints to management were ignored. When I checked out I was told there would be no charge because of above complaints; two days later they charged my credit card. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So here's the story, my wife just flew in from Cali and has a twelve hour lay over, with no money available, she calls me, (I'm in England), she explains the situation, so I hang up with her, jump online and book a reservation with Comfort Inn BWI Airport. Well, I call the Hotel, and the customer service rep answers the phone... to make a long story short, the phone call ended with my blood boiling and a not so nice closing sentence...... Well my wife did not end up staying there, not that I would have even wanted to pay for a hotel service that has junk like that working as a representative.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn BWI Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 6921 Baltimore-Annapolis Blvd, Baltimore, MD 21225
